English:
Did you know that the first vending machine ever
in Japan was in Ueno Park?
Chinese:
你知道嗎？　聽說日本第一台自動販賣機，
是設置在上野公園喔……
Korean:
알고 있어? 일본 최초의 자동판매기는
우에노 공원에 설치되었다고 해…
German:
Wusstest du, dass es im Ueno-Park den ersten
Verkaufsautomaten in Japan gab?

English:
*swoon* You're so smart, sweetie. Even the fancy
researchers at the museum would be impressed!
Chinese:
呀～　親愛的你好了解喔！
連這種冷知識都會，就連博物館的
偉大博士都會驚訝呢！
Korean:
몰라~, 달링도 참 엄청 잘 아네!!
잡학도 잘 알다니, 박물관의 잘난 박사님도 깜짝 놀랄 거야!
German:
*Schwärm* Du bist ja so klug, Süßer. Selbst die
klugen Forscher im Museum wären beeindruckt!

English:
Young people are so carefree. Even with everything
that's going on, they're acting as if things are
completely normal.
Chinese:
年輕人還真是樂天啊……
在這種情況下，還能夠卿卿我我。
Korean:
젊은 것들은 무사태평하구먼…
이런 상황에서도 잘도 꽁냥거리고 있어
German:
Junge Leute sind so sorglos. Trotz allem, was
hier geschieht, tun sie, als ob das völlig normal
ist.

English: Oh my god! A talking armadillo! What's going on?!
Chinese:
咦……犰狳講話了！？
究竟是發生什麼事了！？
Korean:
으아아아아아아…아르마딜로가 말하고 있어!?
대체 어떻게 된 거야!?
German:
Du meine Güte! Ein sprechendes Gürteltier!
Was soll denn das?!

English:
The museum? It's straight down here. Let me be the
first to tell you though, you don't want any part
of that right now.
Chinese:
博物館？　往那條路直直就會到了……
太危險了，現在不要過去比較好！
Korean:
박물관? 저쪽 길을 쭉 가면 있는데…
위험하니까 지금은 안 가는 편이 좋을 거야!
German:
Das Museum? Da entlang. Aber ich sag dir gleich,
da willst du jetzt auf gar keinen Fall hin.

English:
I'm not an armadillo! I'm Armadillomon! What are
you? Oldmanmon?
Chinese:
我才不是犰狳咧！　我是穿山獸！
大叔你是誰啊？
Korean:
아르마딜로가 아니야~! 나는 아르마몬!
아저씨는 무슨 몬이야~?
German:
Ich bin kein Gürteltier! Ich bin Armadillomon!
Was bist du? Altermannmon?

English:
There are lots of places to sleep, but where can
I get some food? Do you know?
Chinese:
能睡覺的地方到處都有，
但食物要去哪裡才找得到？　
你知道嗎？
Korean:
잘 곳은 잔뜩 있는데 밥은 어디로 가야
먹을 수 있을까~? 너, 알고 있어?
German:
Es gibt viele Orte zum Schlafen, aber wo bekomme
ich Essen? Weißt du das?

English:
This place is huge. And the plants are so nice!
I'm gonna make it my territory!
Chinese:
這附近很大，樹草也很多，看起來很舒服啊！
我要把這當作本大爺的地盤！
Korean:
이 근처는 넓은 데다가 초목도 있으니 지내기에 좋을 것 같네!
이 몸의 영역으로 삼아주마!
German:
Dieser Ort ist riesig. Und die Pflanzen sind so
schön! Diesen Ort mache ich zu meinem Gebiet!

English:
(Still haven't heard from Erika and the others!
I'd better hurry back!)
Chinese:
（艾莉卡沒有聯絡……
　得快點回去才行……！）
German:
(Ich habe immer noch nichts von Erika und den
anderen gehört! Ich sollte lieber schnell
zurückgehen!)
